What is JSA or JRA?
tips: Job Safety Analysis or Job Risk Assessment.
Identifies hazards involved in the job and their controls.
Example: Removing PSV/PRV from Gas Circuit.
Hazard 1: High Pressure (Energy) - Control: Isolate PRV, depressurise.
Hazard 2: Flammable, Toxic Gas (Gas Release) - Control: Continuous Gas Monitoring, know wind direction, muster point, exit route.
Hazard 3: Manual Handling, Hot Surface, pinch points - Control: Use PPEs, follow procedure, let temperature down.
Hazard 4: Lifting activity (Falling Object) - Control: Use Proper Tool & Technique, barricade area.
Hazard 5: Weather (high wind, temperature, rain) - Control: Stop job, take rest cycle, follow procedure as per weather condition.
Minimum 2 persons required to prepare JSA.

What is PSSR?
tips: PSSR stands for Pre-StartUp Safety Review.
An important tool for safe start-up before commissioning any unit.
Ensures all permits related to the unit are closed.
All isolation and confined space certificates related to the unit are closed.
Disturbed flanges where blinds were inserted have been removed and flanges boxed up with torquing tag provided.
All vents and drains are closed, and end flanges are boxed up.
PRVs, BDVs, and isolation valves have car seals provided.

questions.question: Why do we need Permit?
tips: To maintain and improve safety standards.
To keep record of non-routine activities.
To avoid incidents and minimize risks.

questions.question: Write Types of Work Permits.
tips: Hot Work Permit: Involves direct flame, validity 7 days.
Critical Work Permit: No flame hot work, validity 14 days.
Certificates: Confined Space, Excavation, Vehicle Entry, Diving, Hot Tapping, Temporary Defeat, Isolation.

questions.question: Write Confined Space Entry Checks.
tips: Emergency rescue plan (with BA set, emergency response team).
Communication (Motorola, IS rated mobile, rope, torch, signals, whistle).
Continuous gas testing (initial test by area operator).
Watchman or Hole Man (entry board time-in time-out).

questions.question: Someone trapped inside confined space, what are your actions as a watchman?
What things will you ensure before signing the critical work permit/no flame hot work permit?
tips: Open permit in the field (verify location and tag).
Ensure zero energy (depressurize, purge, flush equipment).
Gas test done (LEL, H2S, flammability, toxicity).
Know wind direction, muster point, and safety equipment location.
Ensure signatures of all concerned authorities.

questions.question: What is JSA or JRA?
tips: Job Safety Analysis or Job Risk Assessment.
Hazards involved in the job and their controls (stepwise).
Example: Removing PSV/PRV from gas circuit.
Hazard 1: High pressure, control: isolate PRV and depressurize.
Hazard 2: Flammable/toxic gas, control: continuous gas monitoring.
Hazard 3: Manual handling, control: use PPEs, follow procedure.
Hazard 4: Lifting activity, control: use proper tools and techniques.
Hazard 5: Weather conditions, control: stop job, take rest cycles.

questions.question: What is the hierarchy of control for risks and hazards?
What is a ToolBox Meeting?
tips: Detailed discussion before starting the job.
Covers work activity, JSA, tools to be used, emergency actions.
Ensures safety and understanding of responsibilities.

questions.question: What is a Last Minute Risk Assessment (LMRA)?
What is a Defeat/Force Bridge/Security Bypass?
tips: Used to avoid tripping of critical devices.
Apply defeat before opening the permit.
Get approval, inform panel, instrument tech cross-checks tag.
Close or suspend permit, then normalize defeat.

questions.question: What is Hazardous Area Classification?
tips: Zone 0: Explosive atmosphere present almost all the time.
Zone 2: Explosive atmosphere not present in normal operation.

questions.question: What is the Gas Detection System?
tips: Installed at possible gas leak locations.
Types: Single Gas Detectors, Multi Gas Detectors.

questions.question: What is the Fire Detection System?
tips: Types: Ionization smoke detectors, photoelectric smoke detectors, combination detectors, heat detectors.

questions.question: What is the Fire Suppression System?
tips: Methods: Fire water, fire extinguisher (DCP, CO2), deluge system, foam, FM200.
FM200: Colorless, odorless, environmentally friendly gas that decreases temperature.

questions.question: What are the Classes of Fire?
tips: Class A: Wood, paper, cloth (extinguishers: water, DCP, CO2).
Class B: Flammable gases, volatile liquids (extinguishers: water, CO2, DCP, foam).
Class C: Electrical fire (extinguishers: CO2, DCP).
Class D: Metal fire (extinguishers: DCP, CO2, water).
Class K: Kitchen fire (extinguishers: water, DCP, CO2).
